You creep a little closer to hear what they're saying.

"This is going to be big," one of them says.

"Whatever, let's just get along with it. The same thing happens to every town. You know the entertainment is just a distraction," the other worker says.

"Do you think they're going to do those fireworks again? Those were incredible. You'd better not just stay below deck tonight. Soon enough, when we move on with our lives, you'd'a wished you enjoyed these things while we had 'em."

You wonder what they could be talking about. Whatever they're doing sounds highly suspicious. And what they're doing sounds fairly intersting, but what intersting thing would somebody want to do in Chegckle?

Leave the docks and go home Keep watching
